snippet.title: Best home video products
snippet.description: We've chosen a cross-section of some of the best home video devices to round out any home theater.

snippet.title: Microsoft Vista Home Basic
snippet.description: Windows Vista Home Basic is essentially warmed-over Windows XP, Windows XP SP3. If you're currently happy with Windows XP SP2, we see no compelling reason to upgrade. On the other hand, if you need a new computer right now, Windows Vista is stable enough for everyday use.

snippet.title: Epson PowerLite Home Cinema 2030
snippet.description: The Epson PowerLite Home Cinema 2030 offers a decent image and a good mix of features at a low price, but is still bettered by rivals.

snippet.title: Meizu MX3 (Ubuntu Edition)
snippet.description: Ubuntu is coming to phones and tablets, and the Meizu MX3 and BQ Aquaris offer a glimpse of what that could be like.

snippet.title: BQ Aquaris (Ubuntu Edition)
snippet.description: BQ's new edition of the Aquaris smartphone will be one of the first to market boasting the Ubuntu OS.

snippet.title: Epson PowerLite Home Cinema 5030UB
snippet.description: The Epson 5030UB projector is better then ever, with excellent picture quality for the money and class-leading light output, making it shine in both dark and moderately lit rooms.

snippet.title: HTC One M8 Google Play Edition
snippet.description: The HTC One M8 Google Play Edition will fulfill the dreams of Android fanatics seeking to pair top-notch hardware with a Nexus-style KitKat experience, so long as theyâ€™re willing to pay a premium.

snippet.title: Motorola Moto G Google Play Edition
snippet.description: If you yearn for pure Android KitKat on the cheap, the Moto G Google Play Edition is worth the price, but power users should look elsewhere.

snippet.title: Google Glass Explorer Edition
snippet.description: The frothing excitement around these prototype, titanium-framed wearable computers has the tech world tripping over itself, but big what, why, and how questions remain. CNET dives in to clear up the reality -- and the future possibilities -- of Google Glass.

snippet.title: LG G Pad 8.3 Google Play Edition
snippet.description: Android purists will find Google's mid-sized LG G Pad 8.3 more compelling, but it's pricier than the model that's overlaid with LG's skin.
